elements.title: McLaren MCL38 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the McLaren MCL38 Formula One car (example pictured) won McLaren their first World Constructors' Championship since 1998?

elements.title: hypnosis in fiction (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that most portrayals of hypnosis in fiction are negative stereotypes—usually depicting it as criminal, or seductive?

elements.title: Agus Budianto (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Agus Budianto adopted the nickname "Black Hoe" from his skin color and his work on his parents' farm?

elements.title: 1995 self-titled album (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the cover art and nickname (Tripod) of Alice in Chains' 1995 self-titled album was inspired by an aggressive three-legged dog that chased the band's drummer?

elements.title: Dale Berry (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Dale Berry used his fencing experience to choreograph fight scenes in his comic series?

elements.title: Typhoon Man-yi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in November 2024 Typhoon Man-yi was one of four tropical cyclones simultaneously active in the western Pacific, the first such occurrence in November since records began in 1951?

elements.title: Berenice Olmedo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Berenice Olmedo once sold products made from dog carcasses at a flea market?

elements.title: The Dead Girls (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Luis Estrada declined to produce The Dead Girls as an English-language film before directing it as a Spanish-language television series?

elements.title: assassination of George Lincoln Rockwell (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that, after the assassination of George Lincoln Rockwell, his father said that he was "not surprised at all"?

elements.title: Destination of the Month (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Destination of the Month

San Carlos de Bariloche

The Argentine adventure capital offers great opportunities for skiing, sightseeing, water sports, trekking and climbing amidst the amazing mountainous landscapes of Argentine Patagonia.

elements.title: Off the Beaten Path (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Off the Beaten Path

Sekigahara

This quaint mountain town and battlefield, where Tokugawa won control of Japan, gives visitors firsthand insight into feudal Japanese warfare.

elements.title: Featured Travel Topic (Wikivoyage recommendations)
elements.contents:
Featured Travel Topic

Driving in China

China isn't one of the countries that foreigners commonly explore by driving themselves. If you'd still like to, the first step would be getting a local driving licence.
